    • Method Detail

      • mkdir

        public String mkdir(String path,
                    Object data,
                    DirMode mode)
             throws ClusterInfoException
        Description copied from interface: ClusterInfoSession
        This will create a node at the given path. A node must be created before it can be used. This method is not recursive so parent directories will need to be created before this one is created.
        Specified by:
        mkdir in interface ClusterInfoSession
        Parameters:
        path - a '/' separated path to a directory in the cluster information manager.
        Returns:
        directory path if the directory was created. Null if the directory cannot be created or already exists.
        Throws:
        ClusterInfoException - on an error which can include the fact that the parent directory doesn't exist.

      • rmdir

        public void rmdir(String path)
           throws ClusterInfoException
        Description copied from interface: ClusterInfoSession
        This will remove the directory stored at the path. The directory can be deleted if there is a data object stored in it but it cannot be deleted it it has children. They should be removed first.
        Specified by:
        rmdir in interface ClusterInfoSession
        Parameters:
        path - is the directory to delete.
        Throws:
        ClusterInfoException - if there is no node at the given path.

      • exists

        public boolean exists(String path,
                      ClusterInfoWatcher watcher)
               throws ClusterInfoException
        Description copied from interface: ClusterInfoSession
        Check if a path has already been created. If the path exists, and if watcher is non-null then the watcher will be called back whenever the node at the path has data added to it, or is deleted.
        Specified by:
        exists in interface ClusterInfoSession
        Parameters:
        path - is the directory to check
        watcher - if non-null, and the path exists, then the watcher will be called back whenever the node at the path has data added to it, or is deleted.
        Returns:
        true if the node exists, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ClusterInfoException - if there is an unforseem problem.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: ClusterInfoSession
        stop() must be implemented such that it doesn't throw an exception no matter what but forces the stopping of any underlying resources that require stopping. Stop is expected to manage the stopping of all underlying MpClusters that it created and once complete no more MpWatcher callbacks should be, or be able to, execute. NOTE: stop() must be idempotent.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface ClusterInfoSession

      • disrupt

        public void disrupt()
        Specified by:
        disrupt in interface DisruptibleSession
